header_summary:
A new initiative for gathering Bitcoin developer insights on covenant proposals has been set in motion, aiming to foster consensus for future soft forks by utilizing a draft Bitcoin wiki page, similar to the approach for SegWit support. This endeavor, detailed at [Bitcoin Wiki](https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Covenants_support), encourages developers to contribute by adding relevant opcodes and sharing their opinions, highlighting the importance of community input in refining proposals such as OP_CTV to enhance implementations like coinjoin. 

Jeremy introduced an innovative method for implementing Bitcoin covenants without altering the native protocol, leveraging covenant emulators and signing servers. This approach, which necessitates oracle signers to deposit bonds at risk of confiscation for violating covenant rules, offers a novel solution for enforcing covenants and is further elaborated in a paper available at [https://rubin.io/bitcoin/2024/11/26/unfed-covenants/](https://rubin.io/bitcoin/2024/11/26/unfed-covenants/).

Discussions also explored the technical and economic implications of blockchain reorganizations and the potential benefits of Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT) broadcast in blockchain systems. While examining the challenges of achieving consensus in permissionless systems, contributors like mplsgrant and jungly emphasized the strategic use of BFT broadcasts within known membership pools to streamline project development, as seen with Radpool’s approach towards a functional Minimum Viable Product (MVP), detailed at [Radpool's strategy](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/radpool-decentralised-mining-pool-with-futures-contracts-for-payouts/1262/7).

recent_posts.title: Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
recent_posts.summary:
- A new initiative invites Bitcoin developers to discuss covenant proposals on a Bitcoin wiki page.
- The effort aims to build consensus similar to the SegWit support approach, enhancing future soft forks.
- Developers are encouraged to contribute insights and opcodes, highlighting the significance of OP_CTV for better pools.

recent_posts.title: Un-FE’d Covenants: Char-ting a new path to Emulated Covenants via BitVM Integrity Checks
recent_posts.summary:
- The email outlines a new Bitcoin covenant implementation without altering the native protocol.
- It introduces covenant emulators and signing servers with bond deposits by oracle signers.
- A detailed paper on this approach is available online for further information.

recent_posts.title: OP_EXPIRE: Mitigating replacing cycling attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- Jonas mentioned a significant refactor in Warnet's replacement cycling experiments.

recent_posts.title: Can parallel validation side-step the slow block issue?
recent_posts.summary: - Reorganizing the blockchain deeply could significantly harm the economic landscape.  - Strategic manipulation by attackers could increase mining difficulty, disadvantaging honest miners.  - Enhancing core relays for compact blocks may mitigate slow validation effects, ensuring smoother network operation.

recent_posts.title: Radpool: Decentralised Mining Pool With Futures Contracts For Payouts
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion compares consensus mechanisms and Byzantine Fault Tolerance in blockchain technology.
- BFT broadcast is depicted as efficient in known membership pools like Radpool.
- Radpool focuses on straightforward algorithms for BFT to ease project development.

active_posts.title: CHECKSIGFROMSTACK(VERIFY/ADD)
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions on CHECKSIGFROMSTACK (CSFS) BIP focus on including CSFSV in pre-tapscript versions.
- Debate includes potential addition of CHECKSIGFROMSTACKADD (CSFSA) for simpler script multisigs.
- Brandon Black invites community feedback to refine CSFS(V/A) implementations for Bitcoin protocol.

active_posts.title: ColliderScript: Covenants in Bitcoin via 160-bit hash collisions
active_posts.summary:
- The team's novel method allows creating Bitcoin covenants without soft forks, using Tapscript.
- Spending covenants requires significant computational effort, more than mining a Bitcoin block.
- This method could enable quantum-resistant Bitcoin transactions through Lamport signatures application.

active_posts.title: Slashing covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Slashing covenants present a novel penalty-based enforcement for Bitcoin transactions.
- They use existing Bitcoin script capabilities and Lamport signatures for rule verification.
- This concept might be easier to implement on Ethereum, offering broader applicability.

active_posts.title: LNHANCE bips and implementation
active_posts.summary:
- New Bitcoin features aim to advance Lightning Network and future development pathways.
- Proposed enhancements include output restricting covenants for greater user control.
- Changes could significantly improve Lightning Network's privacy, efficiency, and scalability.

active_posts.title: OP_PAIRCOMMIT as a candidate for addition to LNhance
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion optimizes SHA256 use in LN-Symmetry, reducing validation to 1-2 hash cycles.
- Concerns are raised about length redistribution attacks with a solution via custom hash functions.
- Further details are available in a GitHub pull request, offering insights into the technical enhancements.
